titleStmt.title: Richard F. Vinson to James W. Tate
CWG7809

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: Yours of the 276th ult. Stating that the County Judge and Justice of the Peace of this County had been commissioned on the 21st day of August last has been just received, I reply I would state that the commissions have not yet been received And the lapse of time leads to the conclusion that they have been entirely lost. It is needful that the county Judge Should be commissioned immediately as the Old one is often absent and is now on the eve of leaving the county

Yours Truly
R. F. Vinson clk Co Court,
pr. Poage Dpy

Jas W Tate Esq
Asst Secty
